TITLE.P: Call-off contract for land transport of material/prefab elements and handling on site

SHORT_DESCR.P: 5-year framework agreement with one or several operator(s) for the delivery of services, transport within Belgium of materials and prefab elements (components of gas stations) and handling of these materials and components on site. On site means existing stations as well as new sites under construction. As most of the materials and components are for high pressure gas transport, it are heavy items. The vehicles and equipment shall be foreseen for this type of freight. Staff must be trained and the fleet must be certified for this scope of work. All different sizes and types of transport together, the past years we had a call-off of 450 to 500 transports per year (this number is an indication only).

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The candidate must have the necessary economic and financial standing to perform the contract.
1) Proof of the candidate's economic and financial standing may be furnished by one or more of the following references:

— the presentation of financial statements or extracts from the financial statements, where publication of financial statements is required under the law of the country in which the economic operator is established,

— a statement of the economic operator's overall turnover of the last three financial years available, depending on the date on which the undertaking was set up or the economic operator started trading.
2) The candidate must also provide evidence of relevant professional risk indemnity insurance.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: 1) The candidate must have an average yearly turnover of at least EUR 1 000 000. This criterion applies to the candidate as a whole, i.e. through the combined capacity of all members of the group in case of a group of economic operators.
In addition, the ratio between assets and liabilities must be above 1.2. This criterion applies to each member of the group in case of a group of economic operators.
2) The relevant professional risk indemnity insurance must have a minimum coverage of EUR 1 250 000.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The candidate must have the necessary technical and professional ability to perform the contract. Proof of the candidate's ability must be furnished by the following means (in case of a joint tender, the combined capacity of all members is taken into account):
Criterion 1: Be in line with Belgian social rules and legislation on transport and traffic law (copy of registration paper to be provided).
Criterion 2: The candidate shall confirm in writing that 80 % of the vehicles and equipment used are not older than 8 years (age of the fleet and own assets versus rental to be specified per item).
Criterion 3: 80 % of staff and drivers must at least be able to express themselves in a comprehensible way in French/Dutch. The candidate will provide the list of his drivers.
Criterion 4: The candidate shall confirm in writing that he will be able to make transport/crane work during the night and weekend (when required).

Criterion 5: The candidate shall confirm in writing that he will be able to carry out exceptional transports with the following dimensions: Length 30m, height 4,5m and width 4,5m, including signalization and escorting vehicle(s) — Dimensions are for the combination truck + freight.

Criterion 6: The candidate shall confirm the following: If the available vehicles and equipment are insufficient and that a part of the work is subcontracted, the subcontractor must meet the criteria’s 1 – 2 – 3 – 4 – and 8 as the main contractor.
Criterion 7: The candidate shall confirm in writing that his minimal transportation capacity contains the following:
— 3 tractors with crane 30 to 40 tons (± 100 transports/year),
— 2 tractors with crane 60 to 65 tons (± 10 transports/year),
— 3 crane trucks 25 tons (with a platform of at least 6m) (± 70 transports/year),
— 1 truck with hookloader containersystem capable to carry up to 20 m3 containers,
— 1 van with tail lift up to 1000kg, capable to transport tubing up to 6m long,
— Small van for transport of urgent parcels (± 70 transports/year),
— Pilot vehicles for exceptional transport escort.

Criterion 8: Valid ADR-license (transport of Dangerous Goods) – or complies at least with the exemption according to 1.1.3 of the European Agreement concerning the International carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road (ECE/TRANS/257 Vol I and II applicable as from 1.1.2015) respecting the limits as stated in 1.1.3.6 (quantities per category) (valid ADR-license to be provided).
This legislation also applies for National transport.

INFO_ADD.P: Requests to participate must be sent in (i) one paper printed and (ii) one USB versions by the date and time as specified under "IV.2.2) Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate".
The candidates must fill in the European single procurement document (ESPD) at the following address: https://ec.europa.eu/tools/espd/filter?lang=en
The following parts and questions of the ESPD must be answered:
— Part I (Information concerning the procurement procedure and the contracting entity),
— Part II (Information concerning the economic operator),

— Part IV (Selection criteria): [A], [B], [C] and [D] with regard to the selection criteria mentioned in this contract notice; economic operators may not use Part IV, α, regarding the global indication for all selection criteria,
When filled in, the ESPD should be printed and sent to Fluxys together with the request to participate.

Where the economic operator relies on the capacities of other entities in order to prove its economic, financial, technical or professional capacity, it must also provide the ESPD in respect of such entities.
